original_title: If toxic air is a monument to slavery, how do we take it down?
overview: A stretch of the Mississippi River once called "Plantation Country" is now the "Petrochemical Corridor", known to those who breathe its toxic air as "Death Valley".  Using advanced cartography and fluid dynamics techniques, we work to support local demands for liability and repair.
title: If toxic air is a monument to slavery, how do we take it down?
